title: Unused crate dependency error confusingly points to a line of source about a different dependency

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
The help text for the `unused-crate-dependencies` error is confusing.  See the example below:

```
error: external crate `camino` unused in `my_crate`: remove the dependency or add `use camino as _;`
 --> ../../src/lib.rs:5:1
  |
5 | use anyhow::Context;
  | ^
  |
  = note: requested on the command line with `-D unused-crate-dependencies`
```

The line of source that's called out isn't related to the unused crate.  Perhaps a better option would be:

```
error: external crate `camino` unused in `my_crate`: remove the dependency or add `use camino as _;`
 --> ../../src/lib.rs:5:1
  |
5 | use anyhow::Context;
+ | use camino as _;
  |
  = note: requested on the command line with `-D unused-crate-dependencies`
```

Although in general, I think the option to `use <foo> as _;` isn't useful, and visually the source code snippet gets the most weight, and the most impact, vs say:
```
error: external crate `camino` unused in `my_crate`: remove the dependency or add `use camino as _;`
  = note: requested on the command line with `-D unused-crate-dependencies`
```
or
```
error: external crate `camino` unused in `my_crate`: remove the unused dependency.
  = note: requested on the command line with `-D unused-crate-dependencies`
```

version: rustc 1.65.0-nightly (350cca3b6 2022-08-30)
